dataitem.lua_chain:
local net_position = instrument["Net position"]
if tb.is_error(net_position) then return net_position end
local pair_instrument = instrument["Pair instrument"]
if pair_instrument == nil then return net_position end
local pair_net_position = pair_instrument["Net position"]
if tb.is_error(pair_net_position) then return pair_net_position end
return (net_position or 0.0) + (pair_net_position or 0.0)

The currently quoted bid price in the market.

The SVI swim reference price defines the reference point of the skew when the SVI swim correlation with the at-the-money forward is not equal to one. When the at-money-forward and the swim reference price coincide, the SVI swim correlation does not affect the skew. As the at-money-forward moves away from the SVI swim reference price, the skew will move along according to the SVI swim correlation value using the formula: t = log(X/ F^u / F*^(1-u)), where t is the input parameter to the SVI skew curve, X is the strike, F is the at-the-money-forward, u is the SVI swim correlation and F* is the SVI swim reference price.
Indicates order settlement period.
ASX corporate action codes
The last traded price.
Par value for Stock Exchange of Thailand.

The SVI swim correlation defines how much the skew moves with the current at-the-money forward price in terms of percent. A value of 0 means that the skew does not move and is fixed by the SVI swim reference price. This corresponds to a "sticky strike" skew. A value of 100 means that the skew moves and only depends on the at the money forward. This corresponds to a "sticky delta" skew.

dataitem.lua_chain:
if instrument.Deleted then return nil end
local underlying = instrument.calculate("Underlying instrument", parameter("Suppress in deleted instruments", true))
if not underlying then return nil end
if underlying["Currency"] == instrument["Currency"] then return 1 end
local fx = instrument.calculate("FX adjustment used", parameter("Currency", underlying["Currency"]))
if not fx or tb.is_error(fx) then return fx end
return 1 / fx

dataitem.lua_chain:
local last = instrument["Last"] local previous_close = instrument["Previous close"]
if (previous_close == nil) then previous_close = instrument["Close"] end
if (last == nil or previous_close == nil or previous_close == 0.0) then return nil end
return (last / previous_close) - 1.0

dataitem.lua_chain:
local adjust_tick = function(tick, price) local mod = math.abs(math.fmod(price, tick)) if price > 0 then if math.abs(tick-mod) < eps then return tick end return tick - mod else if mod > eps then return mod end return tick end
end
eps = 1E-10
local price = instrument["Ask override price"] local is_ask_price = false if price == nil then price = instrument["Ask"] is_ask_price = true end if price == nil then price = 0 end if tb.is_error(price) then return nil end
local viids = instrument["Venues vector"] local tick_prices, tick_sizes, default_tick
if viids.size() == 0 then return nil end
local mic_parameter = local_parameter("MIC", "@MIC") if mic_parameter == nil then mic_parameter = instrument["Primary market"] end
if mic_parameter == nil then for i= 1, viids.size() do tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end else for i = 1, viids.size() do if viids[i]["MIC"] == mic_parameter then tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end end end
if tick_prices == nil or tick_sizes == nil then return nil end
for i = tick_prices.size(),1,-1 do if math.abs(price - tick_prices[i]) < eps or price > tick_prices[i] then if is_ask_price then return tick_sizes[i] + price end return adjust_tick(tick_sizes[i], price) end end
if default_tick == nil or default_tick == 0 then return nil end
if is_ask_price then return default_tick + price end return adjust_tick(default_tick, price)

dataitem.lua_chain:
local adjust_tick = function(tick, price) local mod = math.abs(math.fmod(price, tick)) if price > 0 then if mod > eps then return mod end return tick else if math.abs(tick-mod) < eps then return tick end return tick - mod end end
eps = 1E-10
local price = instrument["Ask override price"] local is_ask_price = false if price == nil then price = instrument["Ask"] is_ask_price = true end if price == nil then price = 0 end if tb.is_error(price) then return nil end
local viids = instrument["Venues vector"] local tick_prices, tick_sizes, default_tick
if viids.size() == 0 then return nil end
local mic_parameter = local_parameter("MIC", "@MIC") if mic_parameter == nil then mic_parameter = instrument["Primary market"] end
if mic_parameter == nil then for i= 1, viids.size() do tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end else for i = 1, viids.size() do if viids[i]["MIC"] == mic_parameter then tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end end end
if tick_prices == nil or tick_sizes == nil then return nil end
for i = tick_prices.size(),1,-1 do if price - eps > tick_prices[i] then if is_ask_price then return tick_sizes[i] - price end return adjust_tick(tick_sizes[i], price) end end
if default_tick == nil or default_tick == 0 then return nil end
if is_ask_price then return default_tick - price end return adjust_tick(default_tick, price)

dataitem.lua_chain:
local adjust_tick = function(tick, price) local mod = math.abs(math.fmod(price, tick)) if price > 0 then if math.abs(tick-mod) < eps then return tick end return tick - mod else if mod > eps then return mod end return tick end
end
eps = 1E-10
local price = instrument["Bid override price"] local is_bid_price = false if price == nil then price = instrument["Bid"] is_bid_price = true end if price == nil then price = 0 end if tb.is_error(price) then return nil end
local viids = instrument["Venues vector"] local tick_prices, tick_sizes, default_tick
if viids.size() == 0 then return nil end
local mic_parameter = local_parameter("MIC", "@MIC") if mic_parameter == nil then mic_parameter = instrument["Primary market"] end
if mic_parameter == nil then for i= 1, viids.size() do tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end else for i= 1, viids.size() do if viids[i]["MIC"] == mic_parameter then tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end end end
if tick_prices == nil or tick_sizes == nil then return nil end
for i = tick_prices.size(),1,-1 do if math.abs(price - tick_prices[i]) < eps or price > tick_prices[i] then if is_bid_price then return tick_sizes[i] + price end return adjust_tick(tick_sizes[i], price) end end
if default_tick == nil or default_tick == 0 then return nil end
if is_bid_price then return default_tick + price end return adjust_tick(default_tick, price)

eps = 1E-10
local price = instrument["Bid override price"] local is_bid_price = false if price == nil then price = instrument["Bid"] is_bid_price = true end if price == nil then price = 0 end if tb.is_error(price) then return nil end
local viids = instrument["Venues vector"] local tick_prices, tick_sizes, default_tick
if viids.size() == 0 then return nil end
local mic_parameter = local_parameter("MIC", "@MIC") if mic_parameter == nil then mic_parameter = instrument["Primary market"] end
if mic_parameter == nil then for i= 1, viids.size() do tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end else for i= 1, viids.size() do if viids[i]["MIC"] == mic_parameter then tick_prices = viids[i]["Tick prices"] tick_sizes = viids[i]["Tick sizes"] default_tick = viids[i]["Default tick"] if tick_prices.size() ~= 0 or tick_sizes.size() ~= 0 then break end end end end
if tick_prices == nil or tick_sizes == nil then return nil end
for i = tick_prices.size(),1,-1 do if price - eps > tick_prices[i] then if is_bid_price then return tick_sizes[i] - price end return adjust_tick(tick_sizes[i], price) end end
if default_tick == nil or default_tick == 0 then return nil end
if is_bid_price then return default_tick - price end return adjust_tick(default_tick, price)

dataitem.lua_chain:
-- Get the the result period to calculate for local result_period = local_parameter(enumeration["Result period"], "@Result period") or enumeration["Result period"]["Total"]
local invested if result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Total"] then
local gross_bought = position["Gross trade amount bought"] or 0 local gross_sold = position["Gross trade amount sold"] or 0 invested = gross_bought - gross_sold
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Yearly"] then
invested = position["Invested yearly"]
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Monthly"] then
invested = position["Invested monthly"]
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Daily"] then
invested = position["Invested daily"]
end
return invested or 0

dataitem.description_full: Number of trades in a given portfolio position.
Reference price yearly
Position stream item identifier for TP troubleshooting purposes.
Net position (bought - sold) for the specified period.
dataitem.lua_chain:
-- Get the position period to calculate for local position_period = local_parameter(enumeration["Result period"], "@Result period") or enumeration["Result period"]["Total"]
local bought local sold
if position_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Total"] then
bought = position["Volume bought"] sold = position["Volume sold"]
elseif position_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Yearly"] then
bought = position["Volume bought yearly"] sold = position["Volume sold yearly"]
elseif position_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Monthly"] then
bought = position["Volume bought monthly"] sold = position["Volume sold monthly"]
elseif position_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Daily"] then
bought = position["Volume bought daily"] sold = position["Volume sold daily"]
end
-- Returns nil if both are empty e.g. in currency row if not bought and not sold then return nil end
bought = bought or 0 sold = sold or 0
return bought - sold

dataitem.lua_chain: local underlying = instrument["Underlying instrument"] if underlying and underlying["Do not expand underlying basket"] then return nil end return instrument["Underlying instrument"]
return position["Net position"] ~= 0 and not position["Has synthetic underlying leg"]

dataitem.description_full: Number of trades adding liquidity

dataitem.lua_chain: local instr = position["Originator instrument"] or position.Instrument if instr == nil then return position.get_reference("Currency") else return instr["Strike price"] or instr["Short name"] end

dataitem.lua_chain: if position["Is currency cash position"] then return nil end return (position["Gross trade amount bought"] - position["Gross trade amount sold"]) * instrument["Present value adjustment factor"]

dataitem.lua_chain: local instr = position["Originator instrument"] or position.Instrument if instr == nil then return position.get_reference("Currency") else return instr.get_by_ref(instrument.type_code,"Maturity date") or instr["Short name"] end

Open invested for the specified period.
dataitem.lua_chain:
-- Get the the result period to calculate for local result_period = local_parameter(enumeration["Result period"], "@Result period") or enumeration["Result period"]["Total"]
local open_invested if result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Total"] then
open_invested = position["Open invested"]
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Yearly"] then
open_invested = position["Open invested yearly"]
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Monthly"] then
open_invested = position["Open invested monthly"]
elseif result_period == enumeration["Result period"]["Daily"] then
open_invested = position["Open invested daily"]
end
return open_invested or 0

Transition type is a property used to describe orders that are not very common but in some areas are completely essential. A transitory order is an order that changes from a limit to a market, vice versa or even something else. Two typically orders that use this property is the asian 'funari' order and a more commonly used 'market to limit'. A 'funari' is an ordinary limit order with validity 'today', that is, it will expire at the next close but with the additional property that any resulting volume will at close be executed at market price. A 'market to limit' will be specified as a market order with the desired limit properties that it will get after it is attempted to match at market. Normally, market to limit is only allowed during certain market phases and will otherwise be rejected by the exchange.
Activation condition
The active volume
App status text.

The type of an order (e.g. to make it possible to create relevant filters and reports)

price = instrument["Short name"] if (price ~= nil) then return price end
pair = instrument["Pair instrument"] if (pair ~= nil) then price = pair["Short name"] end
return price

Transition type is a property used to describe orders that are not very common but in some areas are completely essential. A transitory order is an order that changes from a limit to a market, vice versa or even something else. Two typically orders that use this property is the asian 'funari' order and a more commonly used 'market to limit'. A 'funari' is an ordinary limit order with validity 'today', that is, it will expire at the next close but with the additional property that any resulting volume will at close be executed at market price. A 'market to limit' will be specified as a market order with the desired limit properties that it will get after it is attempted to match at market.
